website_summaries.verdict: The wave design and split keyboard layout keep wrists in a natural, comfortable position and the one-touch multimedia controls allow users to work efficiently from this basic ergonomic keyboard.
pros: Windows hotkeys and one-touch controls for audio and video files are built-in
The wired USB connection ensures constant and reliable connectivity during long work sessions
Those extended periods of work are also easier on hands and wrists due to the ergonomic layout, as the split keyboard and wave design maintains the most comfortable typing position
cons: This keyboard does not include a touchpad like some Adesso models, even though it includes a space for one

customer_reviews.title: A really good investment in a comfortable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: OK, I wasn't sure what I would get when I ordered this keyboard, but it was less expensive than others, and it has the ergonomics I Have to have, so it was worth it to take a chance. And you know what? It was more than worth it. My favorite keyboard has always been the Microsoft 4000, However, the Microsoft usually runs approx. $50, so getting this one for $30 was too good to turn down. And I am glad I didn't turn it down. it is very comfortable to use as I can spend up to 10 hours at work!
customer_reviews.author: Leiah

customer_reviews.title: Don't Get This Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard isn't horrible. But it's not good - and it has nothing to do with the layout. It's action is clunky and noisy. They keys have a long way to go, they do not move smoothly and often hang up. I'm a fairly fast typist. And fairly often I hit two keys in a row, but the first one hangs up and the letters are printed on the wrong order. I have not had this problem with prior keyboards. If you want an ergonomic keyboard, don't get this one. Go somewhere you can try out keyboards, so you don't get stuck with one like this.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Bronstein

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I don't have carpel tunnel but I have a cyst inside my carpel tunnel that flares up and causes a lot of pain. This keyboard helps ease that pain while at work. I put a keyboard pad underneath to elevate the front and that helps even more. I noticed some people had issues with the letters rubbing off. I have very long nails and use the tips to type so I do not have that issue. I've been using mine for a few months and other than a little dust it still looks like new. :)
customer_reviews.author: xCapricorn82x

customer_reviews.title: Type away!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The keys are not quite but does a great job. If you're looking for a keyboard that will keep your hands just right then I recommend. Update since purchase. Today 12/30/17. I will say that it has taken a beating. I use it at work for everyday use. I notice the next sentences happening around a month after I purchased. Some letters have already worn off. I am unable to use some keys unless I press hard and some keys just don’t work unless I press multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Placencia

customer_reviews.title: I Really Wanted Wireless
customer_reviews.text: But the lay out of this key board was more important than being wireless. I prefer wireless keyboard and mice because there are only so many accessory ports to go around. This one has not proved to be a problem in that regard. The keyboard itself is very comfortable to use. I had a split (as in 2) keyboard with a detached numeric key pad and I hated the thing. Was glad when I wore it out so I could buy this one. I'll buy it again when I wear this one out. I do a lot of typing and burn up at least 1-2 keyboards/year.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Misses keystrokes
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard has nice feel but quality is really lacking. Many missed keystrokes while using it. This has never happened on any of my previous keyboards. Trying to adjust my typing to make it work by hitting each key much harder... Kinda works when I remember it. UPDATE - 1.5 months later, this keyboard is still very frustrating with many missed keystrokes (particularly space bars). It is now starting to "double-hit" certain keystrokes as well. Definitely will replace with ANYTHING else. I've never faced these issues on any other keyboard (and I bought three of these, and they all have the same problems).
customer_reviews.author: P. Y. Kang

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's probably my fault for not checking closer, but the idea and shape of the keyboard are good. That aside, it's Huge, and the keys are very "clunky" blocks. The way you have to press them slows you down no matter how well you type and I needed this for a job that requires pretty fast and accurate typing. I did notice that some keys do not always register and it doesn't always space. For less critical use it's probably just fine, but if it's for work or very important matters, you might not want this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Tough Zero on the number pad
customer_reviews.text: It's tough on my thumb (I bought this for work and it's a lot of monetary data entry so there are a lot of zeros used). I had to buy some of the WD-40 for electronics/plastics to loosen the button. Now the zero button is MUCH easier to hit, but the period/decimal point beside it doesn't always respond, lmao. At least this one doesn't have a track pad in the middle like my old one did
customer_reviews.author: Wickedwitch

customer_reviews.title: Keys keep repeating themselves even though I don't push them twice
customer_reviews.text: When I start typing quickly, keys repeat themselves.. <- Example. The period key does it a lot, and it seems like the j and the m do it a lot too. I bought this keyboard previously and it is so comfortable, I loved it so much. I spilled water on it and bought the exact same keyboard again. The keyboard did it multiple times writing this review, but the autocorrect fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garbry

customer_reviews.title: Willing to update--
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few keyboards and mice with the company ALWAYS willing to work with me on replacements. Sometimes the problem is immediately apparent and other times it has been shortly after the return window. Very personal response from returns department. I have tried the $200 keyboard and found it much less ergonomic so while their products are sign. less and I like them 10X more, durability is the key. So,I now have a brand new keyboard for my new work location where almost all of the keys are sticking resulting in MANY typos. I would like to send it back for a replacement and hope that I can finally have a set at home at work that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: FocusonHim

customer_reviews.title: Addesso PCK-2088 Ero Keyboard Cheapened - keys stick
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Addesso keyboards for years and have had good luck with them. Usually the text wears off the keyboard and then I replace them. They should be embossed. But this latest replacement has really poor key function. They apparently changed key switch vendors or just cut corners. The stick and are not smooth operating. I guess it is time to move on from Adesso. Too bad, I liked there products in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf41

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage, looks like 90's overstock, sticky keys, terrible quality, returned
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Not free return!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this by accident. My fault for not reading that it was wired. I selected to return and chose "bought on accident" and was told I would be contacted by the seller. I got an email with a return label. Followed instructions and found out I have to pay for the return myself. Which cost $52 at the post office. Does not make sense when it says "free returns" on the description.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but the keys are SO noisy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard during the COVID hysteria, because I am virtually for an extended period of time and needed to have a more ergonomic office set-up. My home office happens to be directly across the hall from my toddler twins' bedroom and honestly my one complaint about the keyboard is how loud the keys are. Even when typing very gently, they click ridiculously loud. It often wakes my kids up! So if you need a quiet ambiance, this is not the one. Otherwise, it's great. The quick access buttons for volume are nice and the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, good feel.
customer_reviews.text: Good weight, good key layout. Says it's Windows 10 compatible, and I'm not sure of that, I think some of the Windows 10 specific keys don't do what they should. Then again, I don't know, and it doesn't bother me, I just use the querty keyboard and numbers. It's comfortable for me, I'm used to the Microsoft ergonomic keyboards, and switched because that product has keys that lose their identity quite quickly, e.g. the S key gets blank quickly. And as I age I need to sometimes see what key I'm using. So that's an issue with MSFT, and I won't know about this one for a few months yet. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Strathbogie

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard is very comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I type a lot, and fast. This keyboard has slowed down my words per minute tremendously when I was using it. The keyboard is very comfortable to use, but that is where the good qualities end. When you push on some keys, they do not work. When you push on other keys they type the same letter two or three times. When you type, it also is very loud, so loud it can be heard in other rooms of the house. Definitely purchasing a different brand at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Keys dont hold up over time
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard positioning is great, very comfortable. There were two buttons that didn't work from day 1, but since they are keys I would rarely use, I didn't mind. Over the next few months, other keys stopped working and eventually I couldn't use it anymore. Lasted less then a year.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have been hammering away at this computer for over 10 years with zero problems. I am a computer developer and heavy emailer and work pretty much all day. No problems with bad keys or repeating or sticking keys or anything. Granted mine was manufactured in 2008, so quality control may have been different/higher back then. Super happy with it. Any quirks there might be I have gotten used to over the years. Thanks, old pal!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ro

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Adesso Tru-Form Media Contoured Ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Comfortable keyboard. Exactly as I expected. The curves really help put less stress on your wrists. I have been using it for about 2 weeks and it is working great. No issues. I just plugged it in and started using it. I have had an ergonomic keyboard before but this one was a step up since they tilted the 10 key pad to match your natural movement of your hand/arm. Everyone should use these, especially if you type a lot. The split in keys is so easy to get used to in one day as long as you know how to type. Great product Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: P96

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, great value
customer_reviews.text: Big keyboard, but I think over time you get used to it. I used to have a logitech wave, it was okay for a while, and then they stopped making it with the corded version, which to find became cost-prohibitive. I'm a touch-typist and this keyboard has not slowed me down one bit. I do notice sometimes at the end of the day my fingure tips hurting a little bit, but I'm not sure that is due to the keyboard. I love that just about all the smart key functions work out of the box in windows 10. Still doesn't compare to my old belkin F8E208-BLK keyboard in the past. Also has a usable PS/2 keyboard adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder pain before this Ergonomic Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure I would like this keyboard at first, because of the different feel to the keys. It has a firmer "click" to it than my other ergonomic keyboards. But after using it, I really liked it right away. I bought this for a client's office because I can't use a regular keyboard without pain in my shoulders. This keyboard makes a huge difference, I just don't have pain when I use the Ergonomic design! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jan K.

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is fine but it does not work if you have carpal ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is fine but it does not work if you have carpal tunnel in the shoulders. Because of the 3 inches or so of plastic that’s upfront I have to have my arms more forward than what they normally would be and it was flaring up my carpal tunnel really bad and my shoulders. I ended up having to replace this with the more expensive keyboard that literally Divide in halfcan spread out
customer_reviews.author: snymtns4

customer_reviews.title: Shift key is sticking intermitantly after just a few hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: Well I guess I should be grateful that I discovered this item was a dud so quickly. It worked just fine (although a bit noisy) for several hours and then out of nowhere the Shift key started to stick; not physically but electronically. I would be typing and suddenly get capital letters. Or I would select an item in an app, click on a second item, and multiple items would get selected. I thought I would save a few bucks by purchasing this less expensive option, but this keyboard is junk and its going back to Amazon ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Makinitwork

customer_reviews.title: Adesso makes good products but not this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this long but, the keys are very stiff and hard to press. You can't just tap the keys as you type you must press down until you feel the click. This might be good for somehtings but not good at all for gaming or people tht can type fast. I suspect this keyboard might last a long time but not with me. Mine will be a round file weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ron in Santee, Ca.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great keyboard if you type with your hands staying on their respective sides of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard cannot be used efficiently by someone such as myself who has been typing for 30 years but has never taken typing lessons. It is a great keyboard otherwise, if you type with your hands staying on their respective sides of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: This is a MUST if you type or are learning!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the split board!! I can type so much faster with this and with out pain. Great tool to learn typing on but I will never go back to regular. Any job that I would need it for I would just bring my own keyboard.. It is my desk and my preference for typing. It just makes more sense having left and right keys split apart and my wrists are in a more natural position verses being turned out and in pain after time. I can type for hours without pain because of the way my wrists are with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: key tops in wrong order !
customer_reviews.text: you won't believe this, but the bottom row of keys says: ZCXVB instead of ZXCVB. It seems they got the wrong letters on the C and X keys. Also, I'm not sure this is a computer issue or a keyboard issue but......... When I shutdown, plugged it into USB, and cold booted, the keyboard didn't work at all. When shutdown, and I used the PS2 adapter, and cold booted it works fine. Other than that, I love the geometry and the key spacing and the key feel. But I like a keyboard that I can pound on.
customer_reviews.author: rob sterling

customer_reviews.title: Keys Not Working After 1 Week
customer_reviews.text: Well I really loved this, and I chose to ignore all the negative reviews from others, but now after one week my enter, backspace and back slash keys are not working. So I flushed all my money down the toilet and have nothing to show for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.F

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a good keyboard. As I get older, it's getting more and more difficult to go back and forth between laptop keyboards, and desktop boards. I find this easier than typing on smaller boards. The controls work well, and are placed in reasonable locations.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for wrist issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an exceptional employee who has wrist pains and said that he was looking at ergonomic keyboards and so I got him one! He loves it, it’s easy to use for him (it’s a bit awkward to me, i like all my keys together) and he said it’s helped out a lot with his carpal tunnel and provides a lot of support.
customer_reviews.author: Ames

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item five months ago. It started off awesome but now the enter key is sticking and the letters and numbers are rubbing off. I use this for work so I'm using it often. This is a good keyboard for someone that does not use it a lot because it doesn't stand up to everyday eight hours a day use.
customer_reviews.author: Red Girl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved it if the shift key didn't stick. I love the size and shape and the "noise" of the keyboard, but the shift key sticks, to the point that I have to lift it from the "pushed" position. It's kind of a pain. It was super easy to install and works great with my desktop set up as well as with the USB in the laptop. Overall, it seems you get what you pay for. Relatively inexpensive but I had keys that stuck on day one.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Waddle

customer_reviews.title: I like the lights for caps
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard gives a natural resting work place for the hands, the keys are not completely silent but have a small dulled sound as you type. I like the lights for caps, number and scroll, the quick access buttons work out of the box so I'm pleased with the purchase and would recommend this keyboard to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Squire

customer_reviews.title: What a great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: What a great keyboard! I'm used to Ergonomic keyboards however, this is the quietest one I've ever had! my other one was a Microsoft 4000. thought I'd try a different one. I really like the feel of this one much better! This made my entire day!
customer_reviews.author: katwomanSavage

customer_reviews.title: Backspace key missing stabilizer wire
customer_reviews.text: Take a look under the right shift key, and notice the stabilizer wire (like Stabilizer Bars - Also known as anti-roll or sway bars, that you would find on a sports car). The wider shift key has it.. the backspace does not. It helps with keys that you press on a corner or at an angle. Adesso, why did you leave out the backspace stabilizer? To save cost? It isn't as long as the shift or spacebar, but it often gets hit at the corner and at a shallow angle... so it really needs one. I had to make my own with a paper clip. It helped a LOT.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: OK Quality, not great
customer_reviews.text: It appears that there was not a quality inspection by the manufacturer, multiple letters were missing from the keyboard, others were duplicated and in the wrong position. Very disappointed in the poor functionality of the initial product received. Replacement product (after return of initial purchase) was better - all keys were correctly placed and labeled. Works sufficiently.
customer_reviews.author: m3ow

customer_reviews.title: Overall keyboard is ok but the key quality could be better
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is ok. It really helps relieving the pain in my right wrist. However I noticed that the keys A and F are a little different than the rest of the keys. What I mean by this is, all the other keys, when pressed, they give you a nice feedback that you actually typed it, the letter A and F in my keyboard do not spring back in the same way than the other keys. Sometimes when I have to type my passwords and it includes an A or an F, i cannot be sure if I typed it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This plus an ergonomic mouse seriously saved my wrists. ...
customer_reviews.text: This plus an ergonomic mouse seriously saved my wrists. It took a few weeks using them before I noticed a difference, but it's now been about a year using them, and I have had zero wrist pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape the keyboard is perfect for me but I hate the design of the shift key .. I would prefer that it went all the way across, and the keys are really clicky and loud and a longer USB cord would be nice. I did have to move my computer closer to the keyboard. Other than that it works fine not as sensitive to drops of water as my Microsoft keyboard was... Which is good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more to get a better quality product
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last 1 year before keys stopped working. I ordered one and returned it the same day I received for the same issue. How I have two keys that do not work again. Spend a little more to get a better quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Kristal G

customer_reviews.title: Not Wireless
customer_reviews.text: I never used this, so it may or may not work, but I can say that in spite of the pictures not showing a wire, it does need to PLUG IN. I needed a wireless keyboard and this definitely isn't wireless... Clearly, I need to read product descriptions better. It came up as the second option for wireless split keyboard, but it's not actually wireless.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vancko

customer_reviews.title: OK keyboard, but check the key caps.
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately, I learned touch typing long ago in high school, so the markings on the keys don't matter a lot, but one glance at the keyboard when I took it out of the box revealed an error: The D and E keys were reversed. Also fortunately, I've cleaned enough keyboards that I know how to remove and replace the key caps. Now the letters are where they belong. Otherwise, the keyboard seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: TechByter

customer_reviews.title: Very nice keyboard, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This taught me that I have bad typing habits. Apparently I need to revisit Mavis Beacon Teaches Typing, because where the break is, normally my left hand reaches for those keys on the other side, and if I'm in a hurry, I don't notice. Comfortable fit though, not bulky and works well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schofield

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase/Price/Value!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this keyboard. I LOVE Adesso products as well. I've been buying their accessories and happy with every single one so far. This keyboard feels nice and the typing is fine too. I prefer the split design vs just the curved design. The built in controls and palm rest come in handy. The only thing that threw me off is there is a big square in the center of the palm rest that makes it look like a trackpad is there but that is very minor. Overall I am very pleased with the purchase/price/value!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael G.

customer_reviews.title: What a great buy and its perfect
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy and its perfect. I did wish it had the calculator button as well, but I can live with it. The buttons do have that "push down and hear it" feel if you like that versus the flat buttons now days. Placement is perfect and there is no lag between input as well.
customer_reviews.author: CrunchyDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ergonomic Fit!
customer_reviews.text: Having an ergonomic keyboard takes some getting used to. I like that this one is curved and provides adequate wrist support too. No need for an extra wrist wrest. It slopes perfectly. Because of that, it is a bit bigger than the average keyboard but well worth the extra space it takes on my desk. I only wish it was cordless, but it probably would have raised the price beyond what I was willing to spend. Honestly, for an at home office setup, it's just right.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie W.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising -- this item isn't wireless, as the pictures make it out to be
customer_reviews.text: Truly false advertising. Take a look at all of the pictures -- do you see a cable sticking out of the keyboard? No. That's why I bought it. And now that's why i'm returning it. "Keyboard/Keypad connectivity Technology is wired" -- part of the description. If they wanted people to know it's wired they would not put 5 useless words in front of wired.
customer_reviews.author: odessit

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic is the Way to Go
customer_reviews.text: I just received this keyboard today and I already love it. The flow of working on an ergonomic keyboard as opposed to a "regular" one is so much easier and more comfortable. I spend a lot of time writing when working on my computer so the benefit of this keyboard is phenomenal. It is pre-raised, with no legs under it to raise or lower it. I like this feature, but I know some people prefer to have their keyboards flat so that may be something you don't like. Other than that, it's great! It came quickly and was packaged perfectly, so I have absolutely zero complaints!
customer_reviews.author: QueenEvil

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate - buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this keyboard. It has helped tremendously with pre-carpel tunnel pain. Worth every penny and better than any other keyboard I’ve used. Takes some getting used to but it’s a game changer. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: mark jacob bradley

customer_reviews.title: the quietness of the keys is very nice.
customer_reviews.text: The space bar needs to go across the entire bottom and not be split, as the two halves of the space bar are so short, I have to train my thumbs to bend way under the palm of my hand in order to hit the space bar. So, am keeping this keyboard as a spare instead of using it everyday. Otherwise, the quietness of the keys is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Split but too Thick for slide-under shelves
customer_reviews.text: The separated keyboard is fine and that's what I'm used to, but the keyboard itself does not fit onto the keyboard shelf. It is 1" to 3" too tall and the shelf cannot slide back under the desk as my last split keyboard did.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is a far sturdier keyboard than Microsoft is currently selling. The feel of the keys is solid, which I like. The ergonomic layout is slightly different than the MS one I was using but it is slightly different and took a little getting used to. The reason I didn't give it five stars is the space bars feel a little looser than the other keys and make more noise. A minor complaint. The real test for this keyboard will be durability. The MS keyboards didn't last for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful fit
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomic fit is easy to adjust to as I have used a keyboard similar before. The keys are easy to press, which is nice as I was trying a similar keyboard by a different company and had to go back to the normal keyboard, which was a big component of wrist pain. The size is just right for my work area; minimal adjustments needed. I would recommend the Adesso keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: I started having problems with this keyboard almost from the instant I first started using it. In particular, it inserts key characters when I did not press a key. The first and most noticeable was the small d (d) key, but then others started popping up as well. A second keyboard did the exact same thing, which leads me to believe this is a manufacturer's defect. I returned both keyboards, and I absolutely do NOT recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Unsure about this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say that the key “Enter” was placed upside down. I have no idea why so I turned it around. The shape of this keyboard is nice but the keys are so stiff that it’s hard to type.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Straight up comfort
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard for around a year and a half now and it's great. Yes, it's loud and requires a firm touch to use. For me, those things are positive. It feels solid to me. I adore the split keyboard. The really big plus for this keyboard is that it works beautifully with Linux. I even got a couple of the fussy keys at the top to work, much to my amazement. I'm happy with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clines

customer_reviews.title: Keys stick
customer_reviews.text: In time (few months) the keys loosen to the point they jamb and shift, pushing your finger over to catch another key and severely slow your typing abilities down.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: very easy to type
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get used to the "space bar" but the first time I used the F2 key, it got stuck and won't bounce back anymore. I don't know how to exchange it or fix it. After you get used to the split space bar, it still a very smooth keyboard. very easy to type.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a couple of months. When I took it apart to see what happened two wires were not soldered properly and had come off (I assume they were not soldered properly since they were there but not connected to the board). I had turned the keyboard over and tapped the bottom to remove dust and crumbs that inevitably get into the crevices. I am on the hunt for a new keyboard but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Loose Keys, Duplicate Letters
customer_reviews.text: Backspace key was loose on the first keyboard I ordered. Requested a replacement, backspace key was loose on it as well, not to mention that there were two 'V's' on the keyboard. One where the V should have been, and one where the A key belonged. Obviously not made in the USA. LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Weeziewindpipe

customer_reviews.title: I was so disappointed and had to return it because the keyboards period
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed and had to return it because the keyboards period, semicolon and shift did not work, you cant type without those important elements.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my second. My first was only retired because the connection would not work on my new computer. Yep, my first one was that old....I'm guessing 10 years? Anyway, this new one is quiet, has more options (buttons) and is GREAT to use! I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: ECJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Smooth Typing (aside from the "9" key), but a bit loud.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a good keyboard. I like the shape, texture, extra features. Having the piece to rest my wrists on is nice. Although I think by ergonomic standards, I should be keeping them lifted... My only two complaints are that typing is a bit louder than other keyboards I've used, and the "9" key sticks often. I am sure I could do something about that to fix it, but I guess it hasn't bugged me that me to take the time trying to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Clattering Clunker
customer_reviews.text: There is no way to raise the back for a better fit. The keys are ill placed, especially for an ergonomic keyboard and above all the keys are WAY too noisy. I needed this for a WAH job that is a call center and noise tolerance is zero, including extraneous KB noises and this one was the worst I have ever had! I will pay the extra money to get the Microsoft one which I have used and thoroughly enjoyed!
customer_reviews.author: LadyPegasus

customer_reviews.title: a bit hard on the right side
customer_reviews.text: It sure is a super value but I am not sure that the right side is going to get any beter I can hear the key like an old typewriter. and it is a bit hard but it will do for working from home some time and saving my hands from being in pain.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Flores

customer_reviews.title: Cord's Thicker, So I'm Happy
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Microsoft Natural Ergo Keyboard 4000 at home with this keyboard. My only beef with the Microsoft keyboard is that the very thin cord and poorly-designed cord exit point is so delicate that my cord failed twice - hence the need for replacement. Pros (compared to the Microsoft Natural Ergo Keyboard 4000) Cord is MUCH thicker Cons (compared to the Microsoft Natural Ergo Keyboard 4000) No rubber feet, so it slips around a bit (I guess I can put feet on it myself) Overall quality and feel is lower No padded wrist rest Space bar does not span the full distance between the two <Alt> keys.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rauch

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely like this product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely like this product. Spaced out and proportioned well. Takes the pain away from typing. For those with any sort of arching to the wrists and fingers this product might assist well in ergonomic necessity. The keys have extra layers of painting for the keys- another huge plus. I wear keyboards out fast. Plug and play. No fuss. Worked immediately. Follow the instructions. Easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Panther

customer_reviews.title: I don't love this
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is "clunky" The space bars stick and I have to go back to respace between words. Additionally, it's just not comfortable to type on.
customer_reviews.author: Michele G.

customer_reviews.title: hmm....it's okish...
customer_reviews.text: This is the keyboard I use at work and in my home office. The keys are pretty iffy. Most work fine when typing but some "feel" different. i.e. the 'A' key for the one at work feels cushioned and requires less pressure to get the letter out. The numbers 7, 8 ,9 (on the side key pad) do not work very well form the one at home, you have to press pretty hard to get those numbers out. The "window" key feels like it's cushioned for some reason...IDK. The keyboard is ok but
customer_reviews.author: A. Quintero

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now, one for wokr and one for home. I can type lightning fast on it and my wrists are never sore anymore! So fabulous
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: ergonomic is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: once you use one of these the straight ones are hard to go back to. This replaced my old I-MMT, which just wore out---keys not working and getting stuck. Glad I found one that plugs into my old Belkin switch so I have one KB for four computers, 2 Pcs on windows, 1 on Ubuntu and 1 on mac mini. No issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned it because it did not work with my computer ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned it because it did not work with my computer. May have gotten a defective one. Also, the hard plastic wrist rest is HUGE and not removable! Bad design. If your desk has a pull-out keyboard tray, it may not even fit on the tray. It didn't fit on mine.
customer_reviews.author: Luna E.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing! I have one at work and one at home. My husband hates it because he's all into gaming and using the light up keyboards with a million buttons. I'm able to type with crazy speed on this one, and the buttons have taken forever to wear! I had another one for about 3 years, and started having issues with the shift key sticking, and several letters wearing, so I bought another one, and one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe O.

customer_reviews.title: Keys respond quickly.  Don't have to punch them.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for about three years now. I've dumped a bottle of water on it, and it's survived. The keys respond quickly, and the space bars aren't heavy (anyone who's deal with tendinitis from heavy space bars knows this is important). My office attempted to replace it with a MSFT, but after it tried out, I asked for it back. Long may our relationship last!
customer_reviews.author: Wishing for June

customer_reviews.title: nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is pretty nice. The keys are quiet and respond nicely. The split spacebar is such a great feature; you don't have to worry about hitting the spacebar extra hard to type in a space. Two things I have against this keyboard is that it is just so large, and has a lot of unused space that could be potentially used for improvements. There's a space that would be perfect for adding a touchpad, but they chose not to do that. The second thing is the angles of the keyboard aren't the best and still leaves room for improvement. Overall, it's a nice keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard works fine except the letter "D" has a bit of a ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works fine except the letter "D" has a bit of a stick to it. It's also quite large and takes up a good deal of the desk space. but I'm pleased overall and would definitely purchase it again. It makes a typing sound that is fine with me, but some people may not want such a "loud" board. It certainly gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: MAKE SURE you get one for your kind of computer...this one wrong for my MAC
customer_reviews.text: I already have two, feared they'd break, ordered one and darn it, it's for Microsoft or whatever, not for MAC, so I'm waiting to give it away to a needy person with bad hands.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Campbell Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Works fine otherwise. Like that I don't have to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Noisy. Have to press the keys too hard. Works fine otherwise. Like that I don't have to get batteries for it since it is wired.
customer_reviews.author: Anne from Cali

customer_reviews.title: my hands/wrists are more properly placed.
customer_reviews.text: takes a wee bit to get used to... and, my hands/wrists are more properly placed. I added some fluorescent stickers and it's great. Wish this had been cordless. this is the first corded keyboard i've used in about 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Stavert

customer_reviews.title: This is the best keyboard I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I’ve ever used!! It will be the only one for now on!! Perfect for carpal tunnel so helps with the discomfort that you have with other keyboards. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The keys are a bit loud but I love the ergonomic shape.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Spacebar terrible
customer_reviews.text: I retrned it because space bar didn'twork. Furthermore, even if it did work, it is way too short to use. it is split into two halves. Why?????Loved the keyboard otherwise, but my thumbs just keep hitting the centerpart where thereis no spacebar.
customer_reviews.author: W. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Hard to depress keys
customer_reviews.text: My main objection is the way the keys depress. They go down a long way, and you need to press on them in a pretty vertical manner in order for them to go down. I was expecting something more user-friendly for my fingers. Touch is much worse than the previous two Adesso ergonomic keyboards I have owned. What happened? Does no one make a truly ergonomic keyboard that requires only a very light touch to depress the keys? I love the feel of my wife's Mac keyboard, but Apple doesn't seem to make an ergonomic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mustain

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands so this keyboard the so wonderful IM able to work all day without the discomfort
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the Road on This One
customer_reviews.text: As an IT guy. Keyboards/mice etc... are key to work. I've used a lot of different ones. note that this is a very personal choice. everyone likes different keyboards. I only use ergonomic keyboards while many people I work with can't stand them. I found this one to be built with to much height and the keyboard responsiveness to be lower than I would like. It has some nice features, but where the rubber hits the road this isn't my favorite keyboard. I much prefer the MSFT Sculpt, or MSFT Ergo 4000.
customer_reviews.author: ezseattle

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Exactly what I expected. Switching from a laptop to a desktop, it does take more effort to press the keys of this particular keyboard. But my biggest complaint about the laptop was the super shallow and weak keys. I am much happier to be back on a desktop with this comfortable, chunky keyboard. I love how the keys feel!
customer_reviews.author: GeekedOut

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This ergonomic design really helps my wrists while typing for long periods. I've been using this style for so long, the straight keyboards are a bit difficult to use. The pad for your hands is nice. There are some helpful quick keys at the top, like volume control and mute, at the top. I've been using this particular one for some time now and it's is holding up well and the letters on the keys are not wearing off at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Drumm

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable for regular usage wether it's gaming or writing.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for heavy use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in april and the keyboard has several keys already failing. I type on it all day long 60-90 words per minute depending on what I am working on. This key board did not hold up to the duties it was intended for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard with a split space bar
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Microsoft ergonomic keyboard with the single wide space bar that often jammed and failed to space. The Adessos's key touch is great and I like the special dedicated keys atop especially those for the multimedia controls, but I hate the "windows" dedicated keys and the "menu" keys that cause me to go into neveland whenever i hit them accidentally. I found how to disable the "windows" key but not the "menu" key. Any tips will be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Chacon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE COMPARED TO OTHER BRANDS!
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, I ruined my other one on accident by spilling liquid. Apparently ergo keyboards are pretty expensive, but this was the most reasonably priced one I could find. It works great, and has great skid control so it doesn't slip around my desk. The only thing that is slightly annoying is that the keys are really tall and deep and make some good noise, but that just shows how hard you are working right?! WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Apegrape

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Solid look and feel. Keyboard shortcuts are bit tricky when used with a Mac, since this uses the PC layout. Also I was disappointed that there's no USB port for a mouse or other accessories. That was handy on my old iMacessories keyboard, which is what I was replacing. On the other hand, the audio control buttons are a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this type key board for years. I love the layout and comfort. The key noise is a little loud and after a year or two it seems to get louder. But I still buy them I like it much better than the microsoft keyboard I tried thinking it would be better and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE LOVE LOVE my ergo keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE my ergo keyboard! No more pressure points, my typing is more consistent, and most importantly...it is so comfortable! It takes a little adjusting too but once you do it is amazing! You will wonder how you could have ever typed on a regular keyboard before! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Truly disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was absolutely ecstatic to get this keyboard. As soon as I hooked it up I was in love with it. Now, less than a week later, I have no idea why. Randomly the keys stopped working on the right side of the keyboard. It started with the space key and then the letter H and the ' button stopped working. So it is back to my trusty old microsoft ergonomic keyboard for me. Wish it was otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love it- helps wrist strain
customer_reviews.text: I love this. If you haven't used one before it might take some adjustment but my wrists aren't hurting anymore! It's been ten years since I've had one but it's back to comfort!
customer_reviews.author: KMon

customer_reviews.title: ... now and the one thing that I do not like is that the keys stick a little making it ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a few weeks now and the one thing that I do not like is that the keys stick a little making it so that you have to press a little harder than I have with other keyboards. The one key that sticks often is the W...I have to push it at least twice each time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Kashmiry

customer_reviews.title: and there's a good chance I'll return it
customer_reviews.text: I'm really not liking this keyboard, and there's a good chance I'll return it. The keys set too high, and the pressure you need to put to make the letter register is too hard. It booked itself as being identical to the Microsoft product I was replacing, but it's clearly inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta B. Deloggio

customer_reviews.title: Love/ hate
customer_reviews.text: I have a love hate relationship worth this keyboard. I absolutely love that my wrists no longer are in pain after a day of work. However the #8 key on the number pad sticks. Since I work with numbers majority of the day, it is very frustrating when something doesn't come out because the #8 stuck. If the #8 didn't stick this would be a 5 star product!
customer_reviews.author: Posty4960

customer_reviews.title: Keys hard to press (DEFECTIVE)
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The manufacturer has NOT made this right. Overall, I love the keyboard. The only problem so far is that the Page Down key is hard to press...I used Page Down a lot, so this is a big problem for me. Hopefully the manufacturer will make this right for me.
customer_reviews.author: WARnux

product_meta.title: Adesso PCK-208B - Tru-Form Media Contoured Ergonomic Keyboard,Black
product_meta.description: The new and improved Adesso Tru-Form Media is contoured and has a split key design for ergonomic comfort. The Adesso Tru-Form Media has multimedia keys that make this keyboard a comfortable, multi-featured keyboard that combines a host of Windows and Multimedia keys in a comfortable ergonomic design.
feature_bullets: Microsoft certified WHQL Plug n Play
Dimensions are 2" Height x 19.25" Width x 10.75" Depth

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars640 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
